fr:mainmatter.fr:p: For all n, the system consisting of the complex \operatorname {Gr}_n^W(K_{A\otimes \mathbb {Q}})\in \operatorname {Ob}\mathrm {D}^+(A\otimes \mathbb {Q}), the complex \operatorname {Gr}_n^W(K_\mathbb {C})\in \operatorname {Ob}\mathrm {D}^+F(\mathbb {C}) filtered by F, and the isomorphism \operatorname {Gr}_n^W(\alpha )\colon \operatorname {Gr}_n^W(K_{A\otimes \mathbb {Q}})\otimes \mathbb {C} \simeq \operatorname {Gr}_n^W(K_\mathbb {C}), is a Hodge (A\otimes \mathbb {Q})-complex of weight n.

The following axiom must be satisfied:
1248hodge-theory-iii-8.1.5-chmhodge-theory-iii-8.1.5-chm.xmlAxiomCHM
For all n, the system consisting of the complex \operatorname {Gr}_n^W(K_{A\otimes \mathbb {Q}})\in \operatorname {Ob}\mathrm {D}^+(A\otimes \mathbb {Q}), the complex \operatorname {Gr}_n^W(K_\mathbb {C})\in \operatorname {Ob}\mathrm {D}^+F(\mathbb {C}) filtered by F, and the isomorphism \operatorname {Gr}_n^W(\alpha )\colon \operatorname {Gr}_n^W(K_{A\otimes \mathbb {Q}})\otimes \mathbb {C} \simeq \operatorname {Gr}_n^W(K_\mathbb {C}), is a Hodge (A\otimes \mathbb {Q})-complex of weight n.
